replies.commentBody: Let's also thank the Obama admin staff when this is all over as well. They put themselves at great risk to do this. Trump has clearly been cleaning house because so many of them refuse to declare black to be white so this is no small thing for them and their families. It certainly appears that Trump and his supporters would happily sell out our country for a few shiny coins, but thankfully there are still some patriots willing to raise the alarm. So once all the facts are in and the cases decided, remember their sacrifice.
The journalists at the NY Times and the "intelligence community" are working overtime to get information  - aka they are spying on - the president?  Is this a joke? It sounds like treason.

comments.commentBody: Kudos to the intrepid journalists at The New York Times and the dedicated and patriotic members of the intelligence community who are working overtime to get us the truth about Trump and his corrupt crew

replies.commentBody:
Trump hates, HATES, the very fact that he is being questioned on it. How dare we!?! If none of it was true, he still might be somewhat apt to resist investigation just on principle. However, the rhetoric and actions of Trump and his people suggest there is more than his ego at stake. There is truth there supporting the speculation, if we can dig it out.

Keep plugging, free press.
its own son Eric said they have multiple deals with the Russians and it wouldn't be good for its taxes returns to be released to the public, that's enough for me.

I see know reason why Trump should do anything until he and us see some real proof instead of this steady, trickling innuendo from the democratic party. Lets see some names and dates and places. If Obama and his cronies knew about this before the election why didn't they say something then? Why not say something in January before the inauguration? Yeah, that's what I thought.

comments.commentBody: It seems like this will not be cleared up until interests are aligned to clear it up. The best approach might be to make the case for establishing credibility of the administration in the face of the allegations.  The tax returns and the Russia contacts, if they lead to the conclusions claimed by the administration - that there is no fire despite the smoke, would clear things up and give Trump the credibility he relishes.  Put it to him.  The allegations are based upon facts.  If he has nothing to hide he should agree.  If he has something to hide his refusal will lay him bare.  We all have an interest in having an administration that is free from this cloud hanging over it.

replies.commentBody: This isn't even anarchy; it's nihilism with a fascist twist.

comments.commentBody: Now the Attorney General is alleged to have perjured himself during his confirmation hearing for his Cabinet post. This isn't law and order, it's anarchy.

replies.commentBody: Our Democracy won't survive if people believe these stories pumped out by the Democrats who have burrowed into the government and are releasing lies trying to bring our President down. It is important that Trump fires all these Obama holdovers as quickly as possible.

comments.commentBody: Thank God, for the New York Times and we should thank our lucky stars, Jeff Bezos purchased the Washington Post. Without these two institutions, I can't see how our democracy could survive this attack

I think there may be reason why no one but a fool would vote for someone to be President without first seeing their tax returns. And we know that people who have been played for a fool will often hold on to the bitter end not to admit it.

replies.commentBody:
"Well, what do you know? There is some there, there."

And what would that be, merc? All we have are unsubstantiated allegations by former Obama Administration intelligence officials and Europeans with a likely ax - they all have reason to hate Mr. Trump. Further, there is an allegation about the current Attorney General in which the story neither provides his response nor states that he was provided an opportunity to respond. What kind of journalism is this?

comments.commentBody: Well, what do you know? There is some there, there.

replies.commentBody:
L'O, did you even bother to look at Trump the Stock Market Disaster? Facts galore ...

Point being, guy has no conscience, he lies a lot, his attention span for things he doesn't want to know is nonexistence, he promotes hate and insults everyone he can get at that doesn't lick his boots, and he's in hock to Russia. Meanwhile, climate ignorance will take us all down, as the threat multiplier in chief palls around with the worst of the worst and ignores reality. The planet is a much bigger and unrelenting bully compared to T.

Oh, and Democrats are in general more broadminded and tolerant than the current batch of Republicans (my friends who used to be Republicans want no truck with this greedy dangerous bunch, and I like and respect them). Noticing that he wasn't as outrageous and off the wall as usual was not difficult. Actions speak louder than words, though, and his are despicable when they are not downright treasonous. His enablers are no better. Voter suppression and attacking the free press is no excuse either. The roots of a repressive dictatorship are nothing to celebrate.

Just to keep you up at night -

De Anza College's Ridha Hamidi, Ph.D., says, "More energy from sunlight strikes the earth in one hour than all of the energy currently consumed on the planet in one year.

The amount of solar energy reaching the surface of the planet is so vast that in one year it is about twice as much as will ever be obtained from all of the Earth's non-renewable resources of coal, oil, natural gas, and mined uranium combined."

The sun is warming the Earth up. Do we all go back to subsistence agriculture to protect China and India from their own energy use? How good are you with that hoe?
replies.userLocation: Fair Verona where we lay our scene

comments.commentBody:
To me, it is baffling that "I'm rich" is a reason to support anyone. Trump's "riches" are so clearly the result of a variety of corruptions. In particular, when he was collapsing in the 1990s, Russians saw they could prop him up and have a useful idiot in the US.

It is amazing that any American who regards him or herself as patriotic is blind to the obvious corruption at every level of the Trump administration.

He's an advertising maven. He's not interested in what words mean, but what words he can steal to convince his punters that his lies are truth.

No sooner does something honest appear than he is busy labeling it the opposite of what it is.

We do not, I hope, deserve to become a tool of Putin's Russia.

Do not be foolish! Wake up!

This is nothing but dishonest supporters of OBama trying to ruin this President. And the Liberal Press is in collusion with them.

replies.commentBody: Under oath.  I believe that's a jailable offense. Doesn't matter what was said, or if he doesn't remember the details of the conversation, or if the meeting wasn't in his capacity as a member of the Trump campaign.  The question was did you have any contact with the Russian government and he deliberately lied and said no.
He led indeed, under oath. It's called perjury; I assume an Attorney General has heard of it.

Dre-
Previous Attorneys General have lied to Congressional Committees, Eric Holder especially. Hillary Clinton, and two people from the IRA were the highlights of the past eight years of lying to Congress.

comments.commentBody: Washington Post is reporting that during the campaign Jeff Sessions was in contact with the Russian ambassador.  On the face one can shrug. Seems innocuous but he testified in his confirmation that he never spoke to any Russian official.  He LIED.

replies.commentBody: I just saw it about a month and a half ago, but remember, movies are not reality and are possible disinformation. The military "Influence" on movie making is no secret.

Yeah.  I'm sure Putin can't wait to see the US boost defense spending to upgrade the military, while increasing our own natural fuel output including the same type of natural gas the Russian economy is dependent upon, and seeing the US economy go into hyperdrive while Russia's continues to shrink.  He must be rubbing his hands with glee over the idea of the US with an overpowering military while the price of Russia's natural gas is driven lower.  Sure.  No doubt, Trump is under his control.  Sure.

Bankrupting the country on ridiculous Reagan-esque defense spending, except this time China-facing, sounds like an easy way to take care of an aggressor on Putin's border on the cheap, and take down a former foe across the Pacific at the same time.

replies.commentBody:
Mr. Day wrote: "...oh wait, it's just the main stream media, doing what it does best. Misleading it's Sheep."

We watched the same pattern play out as Watergate unfolded. That administration and this one maintain a constant refrain: it's a conspiracy... they're all lying to sell papers. Your beliefs, Mr. Day hinges on:

A. a vast Conspiracy of the Press, from coast to coast, that, willy nilly, has maintained the integrity of the nation since its beginning,
or
B. a political candidate and his sycophants acting in self-interest

Which of these alternatives do *we* have evidence for, Mr. Day?
I'm sorry for your denial.

Yes, this is what Obama did during his presidency.  Feed the media a "narrative" and have it run with it.  The reason the media is having so much trouble with Trump now is because it has gotten lazy.  It just takes anything Obama gives it and prints it as truth.  The problem is that Trump, of all people, is actually fact checking the media now.  And the media gets it wrong quite a bit.

comments.commentBody: I wonder if people can hear themselves, Who really believes that Obama has evidence of "Russian Hacking" and hasn't released it?? What could they be waiting for, oh wait, it's just the main stream media, doing what it does best. Misleading it's Sheep.
Thank you to the Obama administration and all our loyal government employees who know a wrong deed when they see or find one.
